title: How to Stop a Number from Sending You Text Messages

steps.title: Navigate to the conversation with the user you want to block.
steps.content: Navigate to the conversation with the user you want to block. To easily block someone who is texting you, you can block them directly through the Messages app. Simply open Messages (if it's not open already) and tap on the conversation with the number you want to block.

steps.title: Tap on the user's number at the top of the screen.
steps.content: Tap on the user's number at the top of the screen. If the user is a contact in your phone, you might see a name instead.

steps.title: Tap Info.
steps.content: Tap Info . It's the icon with a person underneath the phone number or contact name.

steps.title: Tap Block Caller.
steps.content: Tap Block Caller . It's a button with red text at the bottom of the screen. This number will now be blocked from texting you and calling you. [1] X Research source To learn if you can block only text messages, jump to our FAQ section below . If the text is from someone who isn't in your contacts list and is sending you spammy, scammy, or junk texts, you can also tap Report Junk at the bottom of the text message conversation. This will report the number to Apple for sending junk.

steps.title: Find the conversation with the user you want to block.
steps.content: Find the conversation with the user you want to block. You can easily block someone directly from the Google Messages app. Open Google Messages (if it's not open already) and locate the text conversation with the person you want to block from texting you.

steps.title: Press and hold on the conversation.
steps.content: Press and hold on the conversation. After a moment, the conversation will get a checkmark next to it to denote that it is selected.

steps.title: Tap the cancel button at the top of the screen.
steps.content: Tap the cancel button at the top of the screen. This button looks like a circle with a diagonal slash through it.

steps.title: Tap Yes to block the user.
steps.content: Tap Yes to block the user. When you block someone via the Messages app, they also won't be able to call you. Their messages will be sent to your Spam & blocked folder. [2] X Research source To learn if you can block only text messages, jump to our FAQ section below . Blocking someone in Google Messages will automatically report the number as spam to Google.

steps.title: Find the conversation with the user you want to block.
steps.content: Find the conversation with the user you want to block. You can easily block someone directly from the Samsung Messages app. Open Samsung Messages (if it's not open already) and locate the text conversation with the person you want to block from texting you.

steps.title: Press and hold on the conversation.
steps.content: Press and hold on the conversation. After a moment, a contextual menu will pop up.

steps.title: Tap More > Block.
steps.content: Tap More > Block . When prompted a second time, tap Block again. To learn if you can block only text messages, jump to our FAQ section below .

steps.title: Can I only block text messages and not calls from someone?
steps.content: Can I only block text messages and not calls from someone? There is no default, built-in way to only block text messages from a user but not calls. However, there are a few workarounds you can try instead: Put your phone in "do not disturb" or "focus" mode. This will temporarily pause notifications for all calls and texts until you turn focus mode off. Unfortunately this is not a permanent solution, but is a quick fix if you just need to focus for a bit. Enable Screen Time/parental controls. Using the parental controls on your phone, you can restrict yourself from using your texting messaging app. This will allow you to get phone calls, but not send or view your texts. Unfortunately this will keep you from seeing all of your text messages, not just texts from a particular person. Use a third-party app to block spam and scam texts. While many phones have some sort of text message filtering built-in, it may not actually block them. A popular app that blocks spam and scam texts is Textkiller , which is available for iPhone and Android. Communicate boundaries with a particular person. If someone is texting you incessantly but you don't want to block them, the only way to get them to stop is to talk to them about your boundaries. Explain when it's okay to text you and why you might not text back right away.

steps.title: How else can I block a number?
steps.content: How else can I block a number? You can also block a number from your recent calls or call history in the Phone app. On iPhone, tap the i button next to the contact you want to block, then tap Block Caller . On Android, tap the number you want to block, then tap Block/report spam .

steps.title: How do I unblock a number?
steps.content: How do I unblock a number? The way to unblock numbers varies slightly between iPhone and Android: iPhone: Go to Settings > Apps (if you're on iOS 18) > Messages > Blocked Contacts > Edit . Then, tap the red button next to an entry to remove that number from your blocked list. Android: Open the Phone app and tap More > Settings > Blocked numbers . Tap the Clear or Unblock button next to a number to remove it from your blocked list.

steps.title: Will blocking scam/spam texters actually do anything?
steps.content: Will blocking scam/spam texters actually do anything? Yes, blocking scam/spam texters will reduce the amount of spam/scam texts you get, plus it can help phone companies identify which numbers are associated with spam activity. However, blocking these numbers likely won't make the spam texts stop entirely, as spammers and scammers are constantly using new numbers (or spoofing numbers with an area code similar to yours).
